title: Joaquin Phoenix’s ‘Joker’ makeup took much less time than Heath Ledger and Jared Leto’s because he couldn’t sit still
text:
Joaquin Phoenix’s makeup artist said it took just 15 minutes for him to transform into the eponymous antihero in “Joker.”

Nicki Ledermann told Dazed Beauty the actor “just couldn’t sit still.”

This makes Phoenix the fastest Joker transformation with Heath Ledger in “The Dark Knight” taking an hour and Jared Leto at a lengthy three hours for “Suicide Squad.”

“Joker” fans can also re-create Phoenix’s iconic look with just a few MAC products as well.

Visit Insider’s homepage for more stories.

Joaquin Phoenix’s transformation into the Joker took just 15 minutes.

According to his makeup artist Nicki Ledermann, the 44-year-old actor struggled to sit still when getting his face painted for the leading antihero “Joker.”

“It took an average of 15-20 minutes to apply the makeup. Partly because it was hard for Joaquin to sit still but also because I didn’t want it to look too precisely thought out,” Ledermann told Dazed Beauty.

Phoenix’s restlessness earns him the title of fastest Joker transformation with Heath Ledger’s time on the makeup chair at an hour maximum, and Jared Leto’s at a lengthy three hours.

Ledger’s makeup artist John Caligone Jr. said in an interview back in 2016 for The Hollywood Reporter that he was “amazing” and collaborative during filming for “The Dark Knight.”

“Heath would contort his face while I was laying makeup on it so it would look like it was lived in. It created cracks and crevices. It was kind of like a dance in the makeup chair.”

caption Heath Ledger as the Joker for “The Dark Night” in 2008. source Max Wahyudi

Leto’s transformation was even more in-depth as his “Suicide Squad” makeup routine included six or seven layers and took three hours to finish.

His artist Alessandro Bertolazzi told The Hollywood Reporter that Leto was “completely in connection with me.”

“Jared was amazing. We had a special makeup department only for Jared. When he arrived in the morning, he’d come straight to the makeup department.”

caption Jared Leto’s take on the Joker in 2016’s “Suicide Squad.” source Warner Bros.

While the verdict is still out as to whether Ledermann will gain an Oscar nomination for her work, Joker fans wanting some Halloween inspiration are able to re-create the look with a few products from MAC.

“The main products I used for the Joker and all the clowns were the MAC Chromacakes in Cyan, Pure White, Basic Red, Landscape Green, and Black Black,” Ledermann said.
